New-York Historical Society
Louis H. Fried photographs
Fried, Louis H.
PR 401
47 items in 1 folder
1930-1939 This collection consists of 47 black and white photographs of New York City. The photographs were taken by amateur photographer Louis H. Fried between 1930 and 1939.
Access Restrictions
Open to qualified researchers by appointment only.
Use Restrictions
Permission to reproduce any Department of Prints, Photographs and Architectural Collections holdings through publication must be obtained from: Rights and Reproductions, New-York Historical Society, 170 Central Park West, New York, NY 10024. Phone: (212) 873-3400 ext. 270. Fax: (212) 579-8794.
Preferred Citation
The collection should be cited as: Louis H. Fried Photographs, PR 401, Department of Prints, Photographs, and Architectural Collections, New-York Historical Society.
Scope and Contents
This collection consists of 47 black and white photographs of New York City taken by amateur photographer Louis H. Fried between 1930 and 1939. There are images of Central Park, including a seal at the Central Park Zoo; and images of structures including St. Patrick's Cathedral, the Museum of the City of New York, the George Washington Bridge, and the Statue of Liberty. Also of note are photos from two parades: the Worker's Parade on May 1, 1937, and the "Beer Parade." Though these photos are labeled "Beer Parade, 1933," they are most likely from the Beer for Taxation Parade held on May 14, 1932. Organized by Mayor James J. Walker, the parade was a protest against Prohibition. The collection also includes images of Mayor Walker.
Most of the images have handwritten captions and dates.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Gift of Sharon Ziv, 2019.
Processing Information
Processed by archivist Marybeth Kavanagh, August 2019.
Arrangement
The photographs are arranged by subject.
Buildings -- New York (State) -- New York. Central Park (New York, N.Y.) -- Photographs. Parades -- New York (State) -- New York -- Photographs Black-and-white photographs. Walker, James John, 1881-1946
